newsitem.title: USA: Vanstar, Computer Associates in pact.
newsitem.headline: Vanstar, Computer Associates in pact.

text.p: Vanstar Corp and Computer Associates International Inc said they had agreed to a systems integration consulting pact in which Vanstar would support and install CA-Unicenter software running on Windows NT networks.
Under terms of the deal, Vanstar said it will create a new national consulting service to provide corporate clients with complete planning, installation and technical support for CA-Unicenter.
As part of the deal, they said that more than 300 Vanstar systems engineers and architects will be trained to support CA-Unicenter software over the next two years.
Vanstar has a similar strategic agreement with Microsoft, in which more than 300 Vanstar engineers are now enrolled in or have been certified by the Windows NT education program.
Windows NT is Microsoft Corp's business-oriented computer operating system software designed to run in corporate offices with up to thousands of users.
Vanstar agreed to expand its Network Design and Management National Consulting Practice to include network management consulting for CA-Unicenter, the companies said.
CA-Unicenter is software that manages all the computer systems, networks, databases and software applications running throughout a corporate enterprise.
The CA-Unicenter software's remote management features will enable Vanstar engineers to trouble-shoot corporate network issues from afar.

Using "intelligent software agents" installed in each desktop computer, CA-Unicenter software can alert a remote network manager to deteriorating network conditions before a problem results in a network break-down.
This feature will allow Vanstar to carry out planned network maintenace shut-down before computer systems fail.
While this level of management has been available on mainframe computers for decades, CA-Unicenter software allows comparable services to be the Windows NT-based networks.
